definition: a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
nose
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
green/blue/black/youth/young (of people)
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
to swell/swelling/swollen

sentences.english: The policeman beat the thief black and blue.
sentences.chinese: 警察把那小偷打得鼻青臉腫。

sentences.english: Peter got black eyes in the fight with the rascals.
sentences.chinese: 彼特和流氓大家弄得鼻青臉腫。

sentences.english: Sunday morning, we come home beat up and sleep all afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 禮拜天早上，我們鼻青臉腫地回家然後睡一個下午。

sentences.english: So now he’s indeed in the hospital, with a swollen, unrecognizable head.
sentences.chinese: 所以現在，他躺在醫院裏，鼻青臉腫，面目全非。

sentences.english: I will beat you black and blue.
sentences.chinese: 我要把你打得鼻青臉腫。

sentences.english: You fell off. First time you ice skated you sucked.
sentences.chinese: 第一次滑冰的時候你照樣菜，更是跌的鼻青臉腫。

sentences.english: I have taken a lot of punches and am bruised and bloodied.
sentences.chinese: 可以說我在市場裏已捱了無數胖揍，鼻青臉腫了。

sentences.english: On the side of a distant rural road, a bruised and bloodied Nick cleans his wounds.
sentences.chinese: 在偏遠的郊區路邊，鼻青臉腫的Nick清理着傷口。

sentences.english: He was beaten black and blue.
I soon became black and blue and lost my consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 我很快就被揍得鼻青臉腫並失去了知覺。

definition: half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to boast
lit. as drunk as mud/completely drunk
masthead (of a newspaper etc)/nameplate
to whisper to one another's ear
livor mortis
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
grand dreams/unrealistic ideas (idiom)
